alert.note: Alert for Lubbock (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 14 at 9:57PM CDT until September 14 at 11:00PM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT CDT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Lubbock County. * WHEN...Until midnight CDT tonight. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 954 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rainfall rates with a thunderstorm. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Heavy rainfall rates up to 1/3 of an inch in five minutes are likely with this storm. Total rainfall of 1/2 inch to 1 inch is likely with this storm. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Lubbock, Shallowater, Texas Tech University, Downtown Lubbock, Lubbock South Plains Mall, Lubbock International Airport, Reese Center, Woodrow, New Deal, Buffalo Springs and Lubbock Science Spectrum. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
